titleStmt.title: Mr. Hollis his speech to the Lords in Parliament concerning peace. With a motion for some course to be taken for repairing of trade, that so poore tradesmen may be preserved to hold out during these troublesome times. Whereunto is added a relation of a vision of blood in the skie, that appeared about Redding on Tuesday night last.
titleStmt.author: Holles, Denzil Holles, Baron, 1599-1680.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
